Description: Lip sherd of East Greek (North Ionian?) pottery bowl; lighly convex lip; fine orange-buff clay with some silver mica; interior black with reserved band at rim; exterior reserved with part of painted volute decoration to right, paint at handle attachment to left; inscription cut over decoration.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.386)
